Articles.Content:
Hello! This is my version of Orion with my custom launcher. V2 will contain a smaller service module and make it more realistic looking.

Mods Used:

Procedural Fairings (For The Cap) http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/39512-1-0-2-Procedural-Fairings-3-14-FAR-Euler-support-%28May-10%29

KSPX (For The Launch Escape System) http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/107047-1-0-x-KSPX-Kerbal-Stock-Part-eXpansion-mod-reposted-v0-2-9-11-05-15

Circular Solar Panels (For The Solar Panels Obviously) http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/221137-circular-solar-panel

RealChutes (For The Parachutes) http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/57988-1-0-2-Wenkel-Corporation-RealChute-Parachute-Systems-v1-3-2-3-2-05-15

Download Link: https://www./?gn1j4o1aukamgku (Launch Stage Changed) (It Works Better Now) Tell Me If You Want The Original Launch Stage And Ill Post It

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited May 27, 2015 by BananaIsAFruit
fixed album, added download link

Your album doesn't seem to be working correctly. I'm seeing it as an iFrame of the actual Imgur album as seen within the actual Imgur site. The correct way to code it is [imjur](code you see at the end of the url)[/imjur]. Replace the j with g. Don't worry, it took a while for me to get used to =P Other than that, looks good, from what little I can see!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Imgur album fixed

Edited June 1, 2015 by SmallFatFetus

Still wrong. We can see it, but you're supposed to do this:

[noparse]

Javascript is disabled. View full album
[/noparse]

For future reference, you should generally remove the "#..." part from links before sharing them, as it specifies a place ON the page, in this case which image to start with - when the forum tries to parse the embed code, this doesn't mean anything to it, so it gets confused and fails to embed.
